trans-unit.source: Describes the context in which a validation check is performed.
This class describes the type or member on which validation is performed.
It also enables custom validation to be added through any service that implements the <xref:System.IServiceProvider> interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext"></xref> class using the specified object instance
The object instance to validate.
It cannot be `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext"></xref> class using the specified object and an optional property bag.
If `items` is `null`, an empty dictionary is created.
If `items` is not null, the set of key/value pairs is copied into a new dictionary, preventing consumers from modifying the original dictionary.
The object instance to validate.
It cannot be `null`
An optional set of key/value pairs to make available to consumers.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext"></xref> class using the service provider and dictionary of service consumers.
The `serviceProvider` parameter represents a service that can be used by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.GetService%2A> method in order to perform custom validation.
If the `items` parameter is `null`, an empty dictionary is created.
If the parameter is not `null`, the set of key/value pairs is copied into a new dictionary, which prevents the service consumers from modifying the original dictionary.
The object to validate.
This parameter is required.
The object that implements the <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> interface.
This parameter is optional.
A dictionary of key/value pairs to make available to the service consumers.
This parameter is optional.
Gets or sets the name of the member to validate.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.DisplayName%2A> value is the name that is shown to the user.
If a display name is not explicitly set, this property uses the value that is assigned by the associated <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute> object.
If that attribute does not exist, the property returns the value of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.MemberName%2A> property.
The name of the member to validate.
Returns the service that provides custom validation.

If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ServiceContainer%2A> object is defined at the application level, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.GetService%2A> method accesses it to retrieve the requested service.

If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ServiceContainer%2A> object is not defined or it does not return the service, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.GetService%2A> method queries the <xref:System.IServiceProvider> object that is passed to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.%23ctor%2A> method in order to obtain the service.
The type of the service to use for validation.
An instance of the service, or `null` if the service is not available.

Initializes the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext"></xref> using a service provider that can return service instances by type when [GetService](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.web.mvc.idependencyresolver.getservice\(VS.98\).aspx) is called.
The service provider.
Gets the dictionary of key/value pairs that is associated with this context.
This property is never `null`, but the dictionary can be empty.
Changes made to items in this dictionary are reflected in the original dictionary that is specified in the constructor.
The dictionary of the key/value pairs for this context.
Gets or sets the name of the member to validate.
This property represents an entity member name, not the name of a corresponding data field.
Therefore, this name is not a localized name.
It should be set only for property or parameter contexts.
The name of the member to validate.
Gets the object to validate.
During validation, especially during property-level validation, the object instance could be in an indeterminate state.
The object to validate.
Gets the type of the object to validate.
The type of the object to validate.
Gets the validation services container.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ServiceContainer%2A> property is used for getting services during validation.

If the <xref:System.IServiceProvider> provider that is specified in the constructor implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IServiceContainer> interface, the provider is used to initialize the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ServiceContainer%2A> property.
Otherwise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationContext.ServiceContainer%2A> property is initialized to an empty container.
The validation services container.
